channel.title: Client Remake
channel.description:
Has anyone gotten their act together and made a team of developers to create a custom client from scratch? Would someone be able to make one possibly in another language (I believe so)?
I'm working on a cache remake, but maybe some [u]people[/u] should work on a client–not one person doing a wannabe remake. A client remake could mean a more efficient client for a type of server, more efficient cache use, etc. What are your thoughts of this? It may seem like a crazy idea, but it may be a productive experience, especially since people won't have to use those crap obfuscated clients that we steal.

item.title: Client Remake
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Ah, wintercanon beat me to linking to MGD. Also, I would be doubtful that any of the client team at Jagex has game dev degrees. I’m sure they all but Andrew have comp sci degrees (not sure if Andrew does). But that’s beside the point. You can teach yourself everything you need to know to make a game.

Read full topic

item.title: Client Remake
item.dc:creator: @n10si_t n10si t
item.description:
@n10si_t wrote:

Wintercanon:

Yes head on over to http://gamedev.moparisthebest.com/smf/ or Google some other Java game development communities. Try using the Slick 2D engine for starters http://slick.cokeandcode.com/ they also have some tutorials on their site.

IT LIVES

item.title: Client Remake
item.dc:creator: @TheCyberMan TheCyberMan
item.description:
@TheCyberMan wrote:

[quote=“Wintercanon, post:14, topic:414427”]The developers who wrote the client in the first place have computer science, software engineering and game design degrees. There are few people who are active in the Runescape private server community who have similar qualifications and could write such a client. So it would most likely be far less efficient. Also you’d be in affect either stealing chunks of code from the original client or writing your own game.

If you would like a clean client to work with I suggest writing you’re own multiplayer game to understand how things work from the client and server perspective.[/quote]I was interested in this, but you don’t really see Java MMORPGs except for Runescape, haha. Do you have any recommendations for where to look? I want to continue developing in Java. Good point everyone: making a new client is pretty worthless unless making your own game.

Read full topic

item.title: Client Remake
item.dc:creator: @Wintercanon Wintercanon
item.description:
@Wintercanon wrote:

The developers who wrote the client in the first place have computer science, software engineering and game design degrees. There are few people who are active in the Runescape private server community who have similar qualifications and could write such a client. So it would most likely be far less efficient. Also you’d be in affect either stealing chunks of code from the original client or writing your own game.

If you would like a clean client to work with I suggest writing you’re own multiplayer game to understand how things work from the client and server perspective.

Read full topic

@IlikeArrays wrote:

Shes so high above me, so lovely.

Read full topic

item.title: Client Remake
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

Andrew Ferguson:

The clients for our servers are fine, it’s the server parts that are fucked up. Don’t waste your time on the client.

The client itself is fine, but the things people do to it aren’t

Read full topic

item.title: Client Remake
item.dc:creator: @TheCyberMan TheCyberMan
item.description:
@TheCyberMan wrote:

Rix_:

[quote author=TheCyberMan link=topic=516392.msg3747994#msg3747994 date=1315805480]Or at least make a team to deobfuscate the client 100%–more than what Rename317 has.

You mean “refactor”, right?

I’ve been working on one since August 9 with the help of a few people and it’s coming along really slowly. I have all classes named, I’m not sure about the accuracy of them though.

I’ll most probably release this to the community once it is complete. You can check my github link in my signature and view the progress as of August 28. I’ve yet to push the latest version.[/quote] No, I meant remake

Taharok:

Rebuilding a client from scratch would be absurd. The difficulty of doing it would be pretty much pointless, because your efforts would be better spent on your own game engine.

The point is to make your own game engine. Though it wouldn’t be a Runescape game engine, players could make servers without the possibility of Jagex shutting down your server. I know the cache is also theirs, but the code is as well. I think it would be better for Java learners to study code that’s concise and followable. Again, I’m just rationalizing. I’m not up for this type of work yet.

Read full topic

item.title: Client Remake
item.dc:creator: @pb600 pb600
item.description:
@pb600 wrote:

Erm it will not be Runescape client anymore when you stop using their 20k more items data, 10k more NPcs data , 40k more Object datas, 3k more MapData, 60k More models and create the client from Scratch, i don’t think that would be good a game with 10 models, 10 items and npcs,1 land scape bad done. So you can even remake these codes… But you’ll wan’t to use their data and models meaning that the client still being RuneScape’s client.
But would be a nice redo cache system so ppl would understand better how it works and could do something without tools assistance…

Read full topic

item.title: Client Remake
item.dc:creator: @Coelho Coelho
item.description:
@Coelho wrote:

[quote=“TheCyberMan, post:3, topic:414427”]True, but people are constantly remaking servers, and a few have tried remaking the client and only got so far. Why not make a team? Or at least make a team to deobfuscate the client 100%–more than what Rename317 has.

A remake of the client would be posted in the new Development site because it’s not a Runescape client anymore, haha ^_^[/quote]
I just see no point in it.

Read full topic
